comment.body: Shouldn't here also be an `elseif` on the new hybs?

pull_request.title: Hybrid KEM support
pull_request.body:
(WIP)

Hybrid KEM support for the oqs-provider (#3):
- Combines OQS KEMs with OpenSSL EC-kex
- Uses EVP API for OpenSSL EC-kex
- Wraps hybrid KEM in OpenSSL3 KEM-API
- Extends oqsx.h structures to accomodate KEM and KEX contexts
- Refactoring to use preprocessor for hybrid combinations
- Refactors oqs_test_groups: test iterates over all tls-groups in the oqs-provider

Todos:
- Enable yml-templating for all defined combinations
- Enable more EC-kex (currently only ECX (X25519/X448)
- Document IDs for ECX combinations
- Verify if we want to enable NIST-CAT5/X448 hybrids

comment.body: I like this -- much more in line with OSSL3 concepts!

comment.body: For my understanding: Are these two different key types really necessary? Wouldn't one suffice? Or would a third be needed when adding RSA3k?

comment.body:
Technically one would suffice. Both `KEY_TYPE_ECP_HYB_KEM` and `KEY_TYPE_ECX_HYB_KEM` refer to the same code.

The hybrid implementation choses the classical scheme (ecp/ecx) implicitly using as input (1) a variable that determines which family to chose (ecp/ecx) and (2) the NIST security level of the pqc KEM. That way code is a bit more compact and avoids having to iterate through each individual combination. So the two different hybrid types are because of (1).

A third type would be necessary when combining with RSA.

comment.body: OK, understood, thanks. I also like more compact code in general, but wouldn't it be desirable to also support RSA to get to the same level of functionality with the provider as with the OSSL111 fork? If so, maybe another, more explicit approach might be better.

comment.body: Am I blind not finding this in the patch code? Or is it intentionally not part of the patch?

pull_request.title: Upstream patch for McEliece __m256i_u issue
pull_request.body: This reverts the local changes to McEliece, adds a upstream patch to fix the __m256i_u issue, and pulls the latest version of McEliece using copy_from_upstream. Pulling from PQClean resolves #940. We still need to do another pull from PQClean to get the latest version of SPHINCS.

repo.name: liboqs
repo.description: C library for prototyping and experimenting with quantum-resistant cryptography

comment.body:
Yeah RSA would be desirable, I will add that. Are there other families we should consider (e.g. Brainpool ECC, DH)?
If we have a relatively concluding list of families to support, we can for each of them just define another `KEY_TYPE_` (at the end its just an enum) and code changes are minimal.
Is your concern related to yml-ability of these combinations?
